title: BJP links Gandhis to tainted company
text:
NEW DELHI: BJP on Thursday targeted Congress chief Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi, alleging 'Young Indian', a company in which the Congress leaders are said to have majority stakes, borrowed a sum of Rs 1 crore from a firm allegedly involved in converting black money into white.
Claiming that this is just the "tip of the iceberg", BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra said at a press conference "the first family" of Indian politics should provide answers to questions being raised by them.
The Congress, however, dismissed it saying that BJP was leveling baseless charges as it sensed imminent defeat in the Bihar assembly elections.
"Young Indian is non-profit organization which took a loan of Rs 1 crore by cheque from a reputed company of R P Goenka and returned it with interest also by cheque. All records have been audited by I-T department and registrar of companies and declared ok," AICC spokesperson Randeep Surjewala said.
However, the BJP spokesperson said that when activities of Dotex Merchandise were looked into by the authorities, "murky" details emerged.
Patra claimed that the owner of the company has told income tax authorities in Kolkata about the activities of his firms including converting black money into white.
Patra claimed that around December 2010 a company, 'Young Indian', in which Sonia and Rahul Gandhi have 38 percent shares each, was formed.
He further claimed that in a meeting held at 10 Janpath, on September 23, 2014, a proposal was placed before the board of this firm for a one-year extension in repaying the loan borrowed from a private company.
